text: Angustalius malacellus is a moth of the Crambinae family. It is known from Spain, Portugal, France, Sardinia, Sicily, Italy, Greece and Crete. It has also been recorded from the Comoros, Rwanda, South Africa, Ethiopia, Madagascar, La Réunion, Mauritiusafromoths.net and Fiji.Bishopmuseum.org - Checklist of Fidjian Lepidoptera The larvae feed on grasses, but have been reported feeding on maize plants, causing severe damage. ==References== ==External links== *Swedish Museum of Natural History - images of the type of Crambus hapaliscus Category:Crambinae Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Comoros Category:Moths of Fiji Category:Moths of Madagascar Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Moths described in 1836
title: Angustalius malacellus
